cab.content: TOP SECRETaOTH OCTOBER, 1953CABINETEGYPT: EVACUATION OF BRITISH SUBJECTS of maltese ORIGIN IN A LOCAL EMERGENCYMemorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign AffairsIf there are serious disorders in Egypt, British subjects may have tobe evacuated. Among them are 7-8,000 Maltese. It is improbable that themajority would wish to be evacuated but we must plan for the possibility thatthey might. Most of them are members of families which have been resident in Egypt for several generations. Malta, already over-populated, will notre-admit them, nor is there any other British Colony prepared to do so. Itseems, therefore, that there may be no alternative to their coming to the UnitedKingdom. If this is so, I should like my colleagues to consider what plans should be made for their reception, and which Home Department should be primarily responsible, financially and otherwise.A.E.Foreign Office, S.W.1.19TH OCTOBER, 1953,The circulation of this paper has been strictly limited.It is issued for the personal use of..?ryy..Y\.$n*FrTS...... 1^0C.(53) 29530TH OCTOBER, 1953CABINETEGYPT: EVACUATION OF BRITISH SUBJECTS of maltese ORIGIN IN A LOCAL EMERGENCYMemorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign AffairsIf there are serious disorders in Egypt, British subjects may have tobe evacuated.
